New Records: The Oklahoma City Thunder tied the longest winning streak in franchise history, which was set in the 1995-96 season by the Seattle Supersonics.
Key Match Events: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander led the Thunder with 33 points, seven assists, four rebounds, a steal and a block. Aaron Wiggins scored 15 of his 19 points in the fourth quarter. The Thunder unleashed a 12-3 run capped by an Isaiah Joe 3-pointer to grab a one-point lead, 92-91, with 8:15 remaining. Mikal Bridges paced New York with 24 points.
Pre-Game Insights: The game was a rematch of the 2024 NBA Finals, where the Thunder defeated the Knicks in six games.
Post-Match Reflections: The Thunder rose to 29-5 in the season, while the Knicks dropped to 24-11.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at the Paycom Center in Oklahoma.
Others: Jalen Williams added 20 markers. Josh Hart added 19 points for the Knicks. OG Anunoby scored 20 for the Knicks. Jalen Green produced 27 markers in the losing effort for the Rockets.
Arena conditions or unusual events affec: The game was played at the Paycom Center in Oklahoma.
Historical comparisons or records beyond: The Thunder tied the longest winning streak in franchise history, which was set in the 1995-96 season by the Seattle Supersonics.
